review: I am a bit disappointed with the design of the ChromeCast.  The mini-usb port is on the very rear of the device, extending the 'length' of the device.  This made it susceptible to bending or breaking of the usb port when a TV's HDMI port is designed to accept a device plugged in perpendicular to the back plane.  So when I pushed the TV back to the wall, I inadvertantly pushed the usb into the wall and bent and broke the power usb.  Fortunately, I have another mini usb so I can still use the device.Functionally, I think it's pretty slick.  Its good for what it does.  I would like to see a more seamless integration with more apps/games and the major platform os programs.
